title: Is there a way to share localStorage in State Partitioning technology of Firefox?
content:
Storage permissions are authorized by the user using the requestAccessStorage API recommended by Mozilla, but localStorage is not 

shared. Only cookie data is shared.

I want other way to share localStorage in State Partitioning of Firefox.
creator: as514188

title: Is there a way to share localStorage in Firefox with State Partitioning technology?
content: Storage permissions are authorized by the user using the requestAccessStorage API recommended by Mozilla, but localStorage is not shared. Only cookie data is shared. I want other way to share localStorage in Firefox with State Partitioning.

title: How to disable "Warning: Potential Security Risk Ahead"?
content:
Windows 11 x64, Firefox 110.0.1. HTTPS-only mode disables. OCSP enabled. I've tried playing around with these flags, nothing works.

  • security.certerrors.mitm.auto_enable_enterprise_roots
  • security.certerrors.mitm.priming.enabled
  • security.ssl.enable_ocsp_stapling
  • security.insecure_field_warning.contextual.enabled
  • security.certerrors.permanentOverride
  • network.stricttransportsecurity.preloadlist
  • security.enterprise_roots.enabled

Do not recommend me to click Advanced -> Accept the Risk and Continue. I want to disable the warning forever for all the hosts. For example, Chrome supports flag --ignore-certificate-errors, I need something like this.
creator: kevneenhz

title: Firefox changes scheme (HTTPS for HTTP) when using relative paths.
content:
We are experiencing an issue with our web application... we do form action and iframe src changes dynamically with Javascript to redirect the user to different pages within our app.

We do so using relative paths, however although the website is loaded in HTTPS, "sometimes" when we do these changes in src, or action and then submit... Firefox seems to be changing the scheme protocol, from https to http, thus we are getting mixed content blocking.

But we are not really using mixed content... our calls do not include absolute URLs, so there should not be any mixed content issue.

This is an example of the change within the source of an iframe:

document.getElementById('piframe'+id).innerHTML='<iframe src="../fondo.html" id="ttab'+id+'" name="ttab'+id+'" width="100%" scrolling="auto" height="' + espacio_iframe+'" '+ scroll + ' frameborder="0"></iframe>'

And this is an example of what we do changing the action:

document.form1.action = '../'+url; document.form1.submit();

Both actions use relative paths... and both actions throw mixed content block.

This happens only with Firefox... what might be the cause?

Thanks for your help?
creator: juan.velasquez

title: Spell Check internet based suggestions like on chrome
content:
I used Chrome for ages, and migrated to Firefox. The spell check on Chrome has an option to give use the internet to offer suggestions on spelling corrections.

The option is now called "Enhanced Spell Check" and it states that it uses the same spell checker that's used in Google Search.

Something similar would be helpful in Firefox as the built in Spell Checker is rather lacking and seems to fail often on newer or more rarely used words. Sometimes it just completely fails.

For example: I wrote: "hipocritical" Firefox's suggestion: "theocracy" Chromes "enhanced" suggestion: 'hypocritical"
creator: dexluther

title: troubleshoot mode?
content: I'm in a situation where a website that I've always been able to access is unavailable in Firefox 110.0.1 (Mac Monterey). It IS available in Chrome. When I go into Firefox troubleshoot mode, I can reach the site. So, supposedly, that's pointing to a problem with an extension, theme, or hardware acceleration. So I disable ALL extensions, use the default theme (which I've always used), and turned off hardware acceleration. After all that, I STILL can't access the website. So troubleshoot mode is doing something else. What might that be? You can try the website yourself - http://fiso.spiritastro.net/test.html. That test site doesn't work, nor do others in that subdomain. Any assistance with this would be much appreciated.

title: Firefox doesn't load google search but loads bookmarked sites and direct urls. No error message
content: I switched to Firefox a couple of months ago because I don't like the privacy policies of Chrome. It was working fine until last week, but now, it doesn't let me go to google.com or type searches. It just goes in an endless search loop and gives up without any error message. Nothing has changed from what I've seen/done since before it started. I have tried all the fixes mentioned by people trying to troubleshoot loading issues with Firefox. Cleared all history, caches and so forth. I tried to start it in Safe Mode. I tried various about:config tricks. Nothing has worked. Sometimes randomly it works for a hot minute but ultimately stops. However, otherwise it works great with website url that I type directly into the bar or any bookmarked sites or links I click on. It's just google.com or word based searches.
